Text: Sydney Process ChangesAs seen from the chain of emails below Sydney is looking to me for some process changes Can you offer guidance or tell me who to go to for advice Sue Forwarded by Sue FruscoENRONDEVELOPMENT on PM From Bjorn CT on AM To Sue FruscoENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Re Sydney After a quick discussion with my group I think Sally B owns operations I guess if Sally is OK with it I couldnt see why we wouldent be Sue NRONDEVELOPMENT To Bjorn CT cc Subject Re Sydney Thanks Bjorn A few weeks back Sydney started executing their own Confirms where in the past it had been done in Houston by myself Since I have not heard of this from Houston I would not be doing my job if I let this go unquestioned I assume this is a policy change They are also making advances towards becoming an Asian hub As such there are a few responsibilities that I currently handle which Sydney is looking to take over Houston independently reconciles the broker statements daily the Settlements Clerk could handle All settlements are approved by me in Houston the new Settlements Clerk could handle this as well or someone in Houston could signoff on payment before Treasury takes action I guess Im looking for assurances that Sydney is supposed to become a hub and some information on exactly how autonomous they should become Are they to be completely independent or are there to be a minimum level of controls between offices Sue Bjorn CT AM To Sue FruscoENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Re Sydney I guess I am as good a starting point as any What can I do for you Regards Bjorn H Sue NRONDEVELOPMENT To Bjorn CT cc Subject Sydney Bjorn Are you the person to go to for advice on changing Sydney process and controls Were trying to address the need for some changes and Im not sure who in Houston to go to for signoff Sue

AUSTRALIA COMPLETES FIRST ENRONONLINE TRADEfor your part in making this happen Forwarded by Sue FruscoENRONDEVELOPMENT on AM Heidi Mason PM To Cassandra SchultzENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Sue FruscoENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject AUSTRALIA COMPLETES FIRST ENRONONLINE TRADE FYI Forwarded by Heidi MasonENRONDEVELOPMENT on Paul Quilkey To Louise CT David CT cc Rebecca McDonaldENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT James A HughesENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT EIAustralia Subject AUSTRALIA COMPLETES FIRST ENRONONLINE TRADE Enron Australia executed its first EnronOnline trade at PM today Monday March Details of the transaction as follows Seller Duke Energy Australia Trading Term May VIC Peak Congratulations to everyone

Cc Friends and Family I wanted to pass along the unfortunate news that I miscarried earlier today and will have the procedure most likely Monday to remove the tissue I am handling the news well but ask that you allow me until Tuesday or Wednesday to deal with the situation Of course I am available as always to handle any urgent issues So for today I have ordered myself a huge arrangement from my favorite florist will have a glass of wine with dinner and spend time with both my husband and my best friend Sophie It should be a good day after all Thanks for understanding Sue

TransitionFriends and Colleagues I wanted to give you the courtesy of hearing directly from me that I submitted my resignation earlier today With a bright and busy month at home and another along the way I am finding it difficult to manage my priorities and balance my time with everincreasing job responsibilities I know that I will not work when I have the second child and want to make the most complete and successful transition as possible for both myself and Enron I have yet to discuss with Sally my departure date but have left it open for discussion since I have no urgent deadline to meet I know that I owe the Southern Cone some more process flows which I fully intend to deliver I have greatly enjoyed the past four years at Enron and will miss many aspects of my job and the company If you have any specific requests prior to my departure or recommendation regarding length of notice I would appreciate hearing from you Sue

Argentine Gas Process FlowAttached is the Argentine gas process flow which has been under review for the past month or so by Mike Guerriero his staff in BA and my group in Houston The Southern Cone trading support is based off of this model so it also applies to power in BA and SP I do have process flows for power in both places but I would like to revisit them prior to distribution If you would like them regardless just let me know and I will pass them along asap I hope you have a successful trip Please let me know how I can be of help I am curious to hear your findings Sue home mobile

Argentine Gas Process FlowAttached is the Argentine gas process flow which has been under review for the past month or so by Mike Guerriero his staff in BA and my group in Houston The Southern Cone trading support is based off of this model so it also applies to power in BA and SP I do have process flows for power in both places but I would like to revisit them prior to distribution If you would like them regardless just let me know and I will pass them along asap I hope you have a successful trip Please let me know how I can be of help I am curious to hear your findings Sue home mobile
